Chm 104: General Chemistry II 4 credits Intermolecular forces, colligative properties, chemical kinetics, equilibrium, acids and bases, solubility equilibria, thermodynamics and electrochemistry. Lecture and lab. Prerequisite: Chm 103. Fall '15 Spring '16 Summer '16 Online No sections offered in the fall semester… Sec Days Time Room 1 MWF 9:00–9:50 SC137 1 M 5:00–5:50 SC137 No sections offered in the special summer session… This course is not currently offered online. Chm 105: Foundations of Chemistry 4 credits An introduction to the traditional topics of general chemistry with particular emphasis on their application to the health sciences. A study of measurement, heat, chemical reactions, gases, solutions, acid-base equilibria and radioactivity. Lecture and lab. Fall
